author: Reuters Editorial
title: Iraq reopens airspace as elections proceed without incident
text:
BAGHDAD, May 12 (Reuters) - Iraqi Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi ordered the reopening of the nationâ€™s airspace and resumption of air traffic on Saturday, state television reported.
The shutdown had come into effect at midnight on Friday as a security measure ahead of the voting which started on Saturday morning. There was no significant incident reported by midday.
Islamic State militants, who overran a third of Iraq in 2014, had threatened attacks ahead of the elections, the first since the defeat of the militants last year. (Reporting by Maher Chmaytelli Editing by Alexander Smith)
